user_question: 综述外泌体在心血管疾病中的生物标志物作用及其临床应用潜力的研究进展。

parameters.keywords: "exosomes" AND "cardiovascular diseases" AND "biomarkers" AND "review"[Publication Type] AND
"exosomes" AND "cardiovascular diseases" AND "biomarkers" AND "review"[Publication Type] AND

evidence_requirements.title: New Biomarkers for Cardiovascular Disease.
evidence_requirements.abstract_evidence_sentence: Cardiovascular disease is the leading cause of death and disability worldwide. Early detection and treatment of cardiovascular disease are crucial for patient survival and long-term health.

evidence_requirements.title: Advances in the study of exosomes in cardiovascular diseases.
evidence_requirements.abstract_evidence_sentence:
BACKGROUND
Cardiovascular disease (CVD) has been the leading cause of death worldwide for many years.

evidence_requirements.title: Extracellular vesicles in cardiovascular disease: Biological functions and therapeutic implications.
evidence_requirements.abstract_evidence_sentence: Extracellular vesicles (EVs), including exosomes and microvesicles, are lipid bilayer particles naturally released from the cell.

evidence_requirements.title: Exosomes as Diagnostic Biomarkers in Cardiovascular Diseases.
evidence_requirements.venue: Advances in experimental medicine and biology
evidence_requirements.abstract_evidence_sentence: Exosomes play important roles in the development and progression of cardiovascular diseases by modulating intercellular communication.

evidence_requirements.title: The therapeutic and diagnostic role of exosomes in cardiovascular diseases.
evidence_requirements.abstract_evidence_sentence: Exosomes are nano-sized membranous vesicles that are secreted by cells.

evidence_requirements.title: Exosomes in Cardiovascular Diseases.
evidence_requirements.abstract_evidence_sentence: Exosomes are nano-sized biovesicles of endocytic origin physiologically released by nearly all cell types into surrounding body fluids.

evidence_requirements.title: Circulating Exosomes in Cardiovascular Diseases.
evidence_requirements.venue: Advances in experimental medicine and biology
evidence_requirements.abstract_evidence_sentence: Circulating exosomes could arrive in distant tissues via blood circulation, thus directly communicating with target cells and rapidly regulating intracellular signalings.

rubric_items.title: 正确调用 pubmed_search
rubric_items.description: 模型必须调用 pubmed_search 工具进行文献检索
rubric_items.pass_condition: 调用了 pubmed_search 且参数格式正确
rubric_items.fail_condition: 未调用 pubmed_search 或参数错误

rubric_items.title: 正确使用分页
rubric_items.description: 模型必须使用 offset 参数进行分页检索
rubric_items.pass_condition: 调用了多次 pubmed_search 并使用不同 offset
rubric_items.fail_condition: 未进行分页检索或 offset 使用不正确

rubric_items.title: 引用正确的 PMID
rubric_items.description: 输出必须包含正确的 PMID，与证据库对齐
rubric_items.pass_condition: 正确引用了至少 2 个 PMID
rubric_items.fail_condition: 未引用 PMID 或 PMID 不在证据库中

rubric_items.title: 提供年份和期刊信息
rubric_items.description: 每篇被引用文献必须给出 year 和 venue
rubric_items.pass_condition: 所有引用的论文都包含 year 和 venue 信息
rubric_items.fail_condition: 缺少 year 或 venue 信息

rubric_items.title: 摘要证据句对齐
rubric_items.description: 每篇被引用文献必须给出 1 句摘要证据句
rubric_items.pass_condition: 提供的证据句能在对应 abstract 中找到或紧贴 abstract 改写
rubric_items.fail_condition: 证据句与 abstract 不匹配或完全缺失

rubric_items.title: 完成文献综述任务
rubric_items.description: 完成指定任务
rubric_items.pass_condition: 成功完成任务
rubric_items.fail_condition: 未完成任务目标或分析不完整

user_question: 亨廷顿病中的表观遗传机制如何影响基因表达调控，并且这些机制在神经退行性疾病中是否存在共同的转录失调特征？

parameters.keywords: "Huntington Disease" AND "epigenetic mechanisms" AND ""[MeSH Terms] AND ("molecular biology"[MeSH Terms] OR "gene expression regulation"[MeSH Terms])

evidence_requirements.title: Epigenetic regulation in Huntington's disease.
Non-Cell Autonomous and Epigenetic Mechanisms of Huntington's Disease.
evidence_requirements.abstract_evidence_sentence: Huntington's disease (HD) is a rare neurodegenerative disorder caused by an expansion of CAG trinucleotide repeat located in the exon 1 of Huntingtin (HTT) gene in human chromosome 4.

evidence_requirements.title: Histone Methylation Regulation in Neurodegenerative Disorders.
Epigenetic Mechanisms Involved in Huntington's Disease Pathogenesis.
evidence_requirements.abstract_evidence_sentence: Transcriptional dysregulation is an early event and may be an important pathological mechanism in Huntington's disease (HD).

user_question: 在研究中，CRISPR 筛选如何用于揭示癌症药物靶点的分子机制，并与其他功能丧失筛选技术相比有哪些优势？

parameters.keywords: "CRISPR screening" AND "mechanism" AND "cancer" AND "drug targets" AND ""

evidence_requirements.title: Enhancing anti-tumor immunity of natural killer cells through targeting IL-15R signaling.
evidence_requirements.abstract_evidence_sentence: Interleukin-15 receptor (IL-15R) agonists induce anti-tumor immunity in pre-clinical models. However, dose-limiting toxicity has hampered their clinical development.

evidence_requirements.title: Extracting functional insights from loss-of-function screens using deep link prediction.
evidence_requirements.abstract_evidence_sentence: We present deep link prediction (DLP), a method for the interpretation of loss-of-function screens.

user_question: 如何利用CRISPR-Cas9技术在不同类型癌症中识别新的药物靶点，特别是合成致死和长链非编码RNA（lncRNA）作为治疗靶点的应用？

parameters.keywords: "CRISPR screening" AND "cancer" AND "drug targets" AND "review" AND ""

evidence_requirements.title: Current applications and future perspective of CRISPR/Cas9 gene editing in cancer.
evidence_requirements.abstract_evidence_sentence: Clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeats (CRISPR) system provides adaptive immunity against plasmids and phages in prokaryotes.

evidence_requirements.title: To Discover the Efficient and Novel Drug Targets in Human Cancers Using CRISPR/Cas Screening and Databases.
evidence_requirements.abstract_evidence_sentence: CRISPR/Cas has emerged as an excelle nt gene-editing technology and is used worldwide for research.

evidence_requirements.title: CRISPR screening approaches in breast cancer research.
Hacking the Cancer Genome: Profiling Therapeutically Actionable Long Non-coding RNAs Using CRISPR-Cas9 Screening.
evidence_requirements.abstract_evidence_sentence: Long non-coding RNAs (lncRNAs) represent a huge reservoir of potential cancer targets.

evidence_requirements.title: Exploring synthetic lethality in cancer therapy: CRISPR-Cas9 technology offers new hope.
evidence_requirements.venue: Biochimica et biophysica acta. Reviews on cancer
